intro: Pseudognaphalium gaudichaudianum, commonly known as the yellow everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters, giving it a fluffy appearance. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapting to arid environments. Pseudognaphalium gaudichaudianum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
